subject: Re: Jersey City sword show............ a suggestion, if I may

Moses,

I have kept all e-mails between us since sending you the blade (Jul=
y 
12, 2005). The only mention in regards to the Boshi was that it 
was 'ha=
rd to see'. It was never said to me that it was missing or 
running off. I =
also had no idea this was considered a fatal flaw. 

It would have been all=
 right to tell me that polishing would not 
make the Boshi appear. And at t=
hat point, I would have probably ask 
for the blade returned to me. As far =
as the NTHK (or any other group)
and their Shinsa, all I wanted was their o=
pinion as to whether the 
blade was Sue-Bizen or Shinto-Bizen. 

As I told =
you before, I have learned from this experience and that 
is good. I don't =
hold anything against anybody. I will continue to 
ask questions of you and=
 do future business with you. All is well!

Elliott
